intro: Guichenotia macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered guichenotia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its distinctive large, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in a variety of habitats, including dry grasslands and sandy soils. Guichenotia macrantha is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for native wildlife.
